title: Harder / Softer

en: You've been somewhat self-employed for a while now, but you worry you aren't working hard enough.
This feels like your big shot to have your own company. Who knows when you'll get another chance?
Have you been giving this your all? Guilt creeps in to you.

no_caption: Fight the guilt. You're doing fine.

en: You're not entirely sure the feeling is accurate, but you use it to motivate you forward. You get a lot done, anxiety pressing you further along, working desperately to put your own criticisms to rest.
You finish for the night and finally feel you can relax, but a creeping fear steals into your mind.
"If I don't get this much done tomorrow, I'm never going to make it."
You sit for a bit to examine the thoughts. Where are these coming from?
Eventually you decide your thoughts are not reflective of reality. You could be working harder, but you could always work harder. You don't want to spend life working yourself to the bone.
You go to sleep, feeling like you avoided a time bomb.
